description_np:
• २०१४ फागुन २४: जन्म, चौतारा साँगाचोकगढी नगरपालिका वडा नं ४ कुविण्डे, सिन्धुपाल्चोक । माता/पिता : धनपति र तिलमाया सापकोटा ।
  • २०२९: विद्यार्थी संगठनमा आवद्ध भई राजनीतिमा प्रवेश, श्री कृष्ण रत्न गंगा मावि, चौतारा ।
  • २०३२: शिक्षण पेशामा संलग्न, १५ बर्ष, प्रधानाध्यापक, जनजागृति माध्यमिक विद्यालय, साँगाचोक, सिन्धुपाल्चोक ।
  • २०३५: पार्टी सदस्यता तत्कालीन नेपाल कम्युनिष्ट पार्टी (चौथो महाधिवेशन) ।
  • २०३७: शिक्षक संघर्ष समितिको अध्यक्ष, सिन्धुपाल्चोक ।
  • २०४२: बैशाखमा शिक्षक संघर्षका क्रममा जेल चलान, पटक पटक गरी २ बर्ष जेल ।
  • २०४४: नेपाल राष्ट्रिय शिक्षक संगठनको केन्द्रीय महासचिव ।
  • २०४८: शिक्षण पेशाबाट राजीनामा दिई पूर्णकालीन राजनीतिमा, संयुक्त जनमोर्चाका तर्फबाट सिन्धुपाल्चोक–२ बाट प्रतिनिधिसभाका लागि चुनावी मैदानमा ।
  • २०४९: संयुक्त जनमोर्चाको केन्द्रीय सदस्य ।
  • २०५१: नेपाल कम्युनिष्ट पार्टी (माओवादी) केन्द्रीय सदस्य ।
  • २०५२: फागुनबाट सुरु जनयुद्वको नेतृत्वमा, पूर्वी उपक्षेत्रीय व्यूरो इन्चार्ज, भूमिगत ।
  • २०५७: नेपाल कम्युनिष्ट पार्टी (माओवादी) को दोस्रो राष्ट्रिय सम्मेलनबाट पोलिट्ब्युरो सदस्यमा निर्वाचित ।
  • २०५८: नेकपा (माओवादी)ले सरकारसँग वार्ता गर्न गठन गरेको तीन सदस्यीय वार्ता टोली सदस्य ।
  • २०६२/६३: जनआन्दोलनको नेतृत्व, ताम्सालीङ क्षेत्रका जनतालाई जनआन्दोलनमा परिचालनको नेतृत्व, २०६२ चैत्र १४ गते सिन्धुपाल्चोक ठोकर्पामा आयोजित कार्यक्रममा तत्कालीन शाही नेपाली सेनाले हेलिकप्टरबाट प्रहार गरेको तीनवटा गोली शरिरका विभिन्न ठाउँमा लागि गम्भीर घाइते ।
  • २०६४ चैत्र २८: संविधानसभाको पहिलो निर्वाचनमा सिन्धुपाल्चोक क्षेत्र नं २ बाट अत्यधिक बहुमतले निर्वाचित ।
  • २०६८ बैशाख २१: प्रधानमन्त्री झलनाथ खनालको नेतृत्वको मन्त्रिपरिषदमा सूचना तथा सञ्चारमन्त्रीमा नियुक्त  ।
  • २०६९ माघः एकीकृत नेपाल कम्युनिष्ट पार्टी (माओवादी) को हेटौंडा महाधिवेशनबाट पोलिटव्युरो सदस्यमा निर्वाचित ।
  • २०६९ साउनः एकीकृत नेकपा (माओवादी) को पार्र्टी केन्द्रीय प्रवक्ता ।
  • २०७० मंसिरः संविधानसभाको दोस्रो निर्वाचनमा सिन्धुपाल्चोक जिल्ला क्षेत्र नं २ बाट निर्वाचित । 
  • २०७१ जेठः एकीकृत नेकपा (माओवादी) विराटनगर सम्मेलनबाट स्थायी समिति सदस्यमा निर्वाचित ।
  • २०७२ कार्तिकः प्रधानमन्त्री केपी शर्मा ओलीको नेतृत्वमा गठित मन्त्रिपरिषदमा वन तथा भूसंरक्षण मन्त्रीमा नियुक्त ।
  • २०७४ जेठः नेकपा (माओवादी केन्द्र) को कार्यालय सदस्य ।
  • २०७४ मंसिर २१: सिन्धुपाल्चोक क्षेत्र नं–१ बाट प्रतिनिधिसभामा निर्वाचित । लगातार तेस्रोपटक संसदमा ।
  • २०७५ जेठ १६: नेकपा (माओवादी केन्द्र) र नेकपा (एमाले) मिलेर बनेको नेपाल कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी (नेकपा) को स्थायी समिति सदस्य ।
  • २०७६ माघ ५: नेपाल कम्युनिस्ट पार्टी (नेकपा) को सचिवालयद्वारा प्रतिनिधिसभाको सभामुखको उमेदवार बनाउने निर्णय ।  
  • २०७६ माघ १२: प्रतिनिधि सभाको सभामुखमा निर्विरोध निर्वाचित ।
  • २०७६ माघ १३: प्रतिनिधि सभाको सभामुखका लागि पद तथा गोपनियताको सपथ ग्रहण ।
   


सभामुखको सचिवालय

बुवाः स्व. रविचन्द्र महरा

आमाः स्व. समुन्द्रदेवी महरा

जन्म मितिः २०१६ असार १७

जन्म स्थानः रोल्पा लिवाङ–७ धारापानी (हालः रोल्पा नगरपालिका वडा नं. १)

श्रीमतीः सीता महरा

छोरा २, छोरी २

राष्ट्रियताः नेपाली

शिक्षाः

  • एसएलसी, श्री बालकल्याण उच्च मावि लिबाङ रोल्पा
  • प्रवीणता प्रमाण पत्र तह (विज्ञान), महेन्द्र बहुमुखी क्याम्पस, नेपालगञ्ज (टियू)
  • स्नातह तह (शिक्षाशास्त्र), त्रिविवि नेपाल (पोखरा)

राजनीतिक यात्रा

राजकीय जिम्मेवारी :

  • २०७४ फागुन २७ गते संघीय संसद प्रतिनिधि सभाको सभामुखमा सर्वसम्मत चयन ।
  • २०७४ प्रतिनिधि सभा सदस्यमा दाङ क्षेत्र नं. २ बाट निर्वाचित ।
  • २०७३ उपप्रधानमन्त्री तथा अर्थमन्त्री
  • २०७४ उपप्रधानमन्त्री तथा परराष्ट्रमन्त्री
  • २०७० मंसिर ४ गते सम्पन्न दोस्रो संविधानसभा निर्वाचनमा रोल्पा क्षेत्र नं. १ बाट निर्वाचित ।
  • २०६७ एकीकृत ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)का तर्फबाट नेपाल सरकारको उप–प्रधानमन्त्री तथा गृहमन्त्री
  • २०६५ भाद्र माओवादी अध्यक्ष प्रचण्ड नेतृत्वको पहिलो निर्वाचित गणतान्त्रिक सरकारको सूचना तथा संचार मन्त्री तथा सरकारको प्रवक्ता
  • २०६४ चैतमा सम्पन्न निर्वाचनबाट दाङ क्षेत्र नं. ३ बाट संविधानसभा सदस्यमा निर्वाचित
  • २०६३ चैतमा अन्तरिम सरकारको सूचना तथा सञ्चारमन्त्री, सरकारको प्रवक्ता

पार्टीको जिम्मेवारी :

  • २०७३ देखि २०७४ फागुनसम्म पार्टी केन्द्रीय कार्यालय सदस्य ।
  • २०७१ एकीकृत नेकपा (माओवादी)को महासचिव निर्वाचित
  • २०६९ एकीकृत नेकपा (माओवादी) सातौं राष्ट्रिय महाधिवेशनवाट केन्द्रीय सदस्य तथा केन्द्रीय संगठन विभाग प्रमुख, मध्य ब्यूरो ईञ्चार्ज
  • २०६९ अन्तरिम चुनावी मन्त्रिपरिषद निर्माणका लागि राजनीतिक सहमति–पत्र तथा अन्तरिम संविधान बाधा अड्काउ फुकाउ आदेश मस्यौदा निर्माण कार्यदलका सदस्य
  • २०६९ एकीकृत नेकपा (माओवादी) सातौं राष्ट्रिय महाधिवेशन आयोजक समिति सदस्य तथा केन्द्रीय संगठन विभाग प्रमुख
  • २०६६ अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय ब्युरोको ईन्चार्ज, एकीकृत ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०६५ पार्टी एकतापछि एकीकृत ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)को स्थायी समिति सदस्य
  • २०६३ पौषमा अन्तरिम संविधान जारीपछि निर्मित अन्तरिम व्यवस्थापिका–संसदको सदस्य तथा माओवादी संसदीय दलको नेता
  • २०६३ तत्कालीन सरकारसँग वार्ताको लागि गठित तेश्रो वार्ता टोलीको संयोजक
  • २०६२ असोज सेक्रेटारियट सदस्य, केन्द्रीय समिति ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०६२ स्थायी समिति सदस्य ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०६१ पार्टी प्रवक्ता ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०६० तत्कालीन सरकारसँगको द्रोसो वार्ता टोली सदस्य तथा प्रवक्ता
  • २०५८ तत्कालीन सरकारसँगको पहिलो वार्ता टोली संयोजक
  • २०५५ पोलिटब्यूरो सदस्य, ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०५३ असार केन्द्रीय सदस्य, ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०५१ पश्चिमाञ्चल क्षेत्रीय ब्युरो सदस्य, ने.क.पा. (माओवादी)
  • २०५० क्षेत्रीय संगठन समिति, सदस्य राप्ती ने.क.पा. (एकता केन्द्र)
  • २०५० मा संयुक्त जनमोर्चा नेपाल संसदीय दलको नेता
  • २०४८ को निर्वाचनमा रोल्पा २ बाट प्रतिनिधिसभा सदस्यमा निर्वाचित
  • २०४८ सालदेखि नेकपा (मशाल) रोल्पा जिल्ला सेक्रेटरी (डिसिएस)
  • २०३९ देखि ४१ सालसम्म अ.ने.रा.स्व.वि.यू. आठौं राष्ट्रिय सम्मेलनबाट केन्द्रीय सदस्य, केन्द्रीय उपाध्यक्ष, पृथ्वीनारायण क्याम्पस पोखरा, स्व.वि.यु. कोषाध्यक्ष
  • २०३७ मा तत्कालीन नेकपा चौमको पार्टी सदस्यता प्राप्त । सोही सालमै पार्टीको रोल्पा जिल्ला सदस्य
  • ०३६ सालदेखि ०३९ सम्म नेपाल राष्ट्रिय शिक्षक संगठन रोल्पाको सचिव र केन्द्रीय प्रतिनिधि
  • २०३५–०३६ सालको विद्यार्थी आन्दोलनमा संलग्न भई राजनीतिमा सक्रिय ।

सामाजिक संघ संस्था :

  • २०४१ देखि ०४५ सालसम्म नेपाल रेडक्रस सोसाइटी रोल्पा जिल्ला शाखाको मन्त्री
  • २०३६ देखि ०४८ सम्म विज्ञान र गणित शिक्षकको रुपमा १० वर्ष शिक्षण ।
  • २०३८ प्रधान सम्पादक, हटारु साहित्यिक पत्रिका (रोल्पाको पहिलो साहित्यिक पत्रिका)

विदेश भ्रमण : भारत, चीन, थाइल्याण्ड, अमेरिका, जापान, उत्तर कोरिया, मलेशिया, सिंगापुर, हङकङ, दक्षिण कोरिया, यु.के., युएई, कतार, बंगलादेश, पाकिस्तान 

 

CV in English

Name:  Krishna Bahadur Mahara

Father's Name : Ravichandra Mahara  (late)

Mother's Name: Samundra Devi Mahara (late)

Spouse :  Sita Mahara

2 Daughters, 2 sons

Date of Birth:  01 July 1959

Address : 

          Permanent: - Rolpa  Municipality  -1 Liwang Dharapani, Rolpa

          Temporary: - Speaker's Official Residence, Baluwatar, Kathmandu

Nationality - Nepali

Language - Mother tongue – Nepali

Speak and Understanding – English and Hindi

 

Education - B.Ed. Prithvi Narayan Campus, Pokhara (T.U.) Nepal

                     I.Sc.  Mahendra Multiple Campus, Nepalgunj (TU), Nepal

                     S.L.C. Shree Balkalyan Higher Secondary School, Liwang Rolpa       

 Current Responsibility: Speaker, House of Representatives, Federal 

                                         Parliament of Nepal.                                                  

 Experience:

State Responsibilities

  • 2018, March onwards, Speaker, House of Representatives, Federal Parliament of Nepal.
  • 2017, Member of House of Representatives, Federal Parliament of Nepal
  • 2017 Deputy Prime -Minister and Minister for foreign Affairs Government of Nepal.
  • 2016 Deputy Prime-Minister and Minister, Ministry of Finance, Government of Nepal.
  • 2012 member of task force of draft on political consensus and constitutional for interim electoral cabinet.
  • 2011 Deputy Prime-Minister and Minister, Minister of Home Affair, Government of Nepal.
  • 2009 Minister, Ministry of Information and Communication and spokes person of Government of Nepal.
  • 2008 Elected as a member of constitution assembly form Constitute no.3 of Dang District.
  • 2007 Minister, Ministry of Information and communication and spokes person of Government of Nepal.
  • 2007 Nominated as a member of Interim Parliament established according to interim constitution and became a leader of CPN (Maoist) in parliament.
  • 1993 Elected and worked as a Member of Parliament from constituent no.2 of Rolpa District.

Party Responsibilities

  • 2016-2018 March, Central member of party headquarter (CPN Maoist Center)
  • 2014  General Secretary of UCPN (Maoist)
  • 2011 member of UCPN (Maoist) 7th national congress organization committee & chief of central organization committee of UCPN (Maoist).
  • 2010 Nominated as the chief of international bureau of United Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2009 From the Party unification assembly, Elected and working as a standing committee member of United Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2007 Coordinator of 3st Negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with Government of Nepal.
  • 2006 Standing Committee Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2005 spokesperson of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2004 Spokes person and member of 2nd negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with His’ Majesty of Government of Nepal.
  • 2002 Coordinator of 1st Negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with His’ Majesty of Government of Nepal.
  • 1999 Polite bureau Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist
  • 1999 Central committee Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)        
  • 1995 Regional bureau Member of Western Region of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
  • 1994 Member of Regional bureau of Rapti region of Communist Party of Nepal (United Center).
  • 1993 Appointed as a District Committee Secretary (DCS) of Rolpa for Communist Party of Nepal (Masal).
  • 1983-1985 Involved in Student politics as an Elected Central Committee Member of All Nepal National Independent Student Union(8th) and Treasure of Free Student Union of P.N. Campus Pokhara.
  • 1980-1983 District Secretary of Nepal National Teachers’ Association. National representative of Nepal National Teachers’ Association.
  • 1981 Party Member of Nepal Communist Party and District Committee Member of Rolpa district.
  • 1980- 2000 Involved in the student politics/movement as an active member

Other Responsibilities

  • 1980-1992 Worked as a Science and mathematics Teacher. 
  • 1985-1989 General Secretary of Nepal Red Cross Society, Rolpa.
  • 1981 Chief Editor, Hataru literary magazine Rolpa (First literary magazine in rolpa)​

Foreign Visits:  India, China, Thailand, USA, Japan, North Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Hongkong, South Korea, United Kingdom, UAE, Qatar, Bangladesh, Pakistan.

Curriculum Vitae

Name:  Krishna Bahadur Mahara

Father's Name : Ravichandra Mahara  (late)

Mother's Name: Samundra Devi Mahara (late)

Spouse :  Sita Mahara

2 Daughters, 2 sons

Date of Birth:  01 July 1959

Address : 

          Permanent: - Rolpa  Municipality  -1 Liwang Dharapani, Rolpa

          Temporary: - Speaker's Official Residence, Baluwatar, Kathmandu

Nationality - Nepali

Language - Mother tongue – Nepali

Speak and Understanding – English and Hindi

Education - B.Ed. Prithvi Narayan Campus, Pokhara (T.U.) Nepal

                     I.Sc.  Mahendra Multiple Campus, Nepalgunj (TU), Nepal

                     S.L.C. Shree Balkalyan Higher Secondary School, Liwang Rolpa       

Current Responsibility: Speaker, House of Representatives, Federal 

                                         Parliament of Nepal.                                                  

Experience:

State Responsibilities

  • 2018, March onwards, Speaker, House of Representatives, Federal Parliament of Nepal.
  • 2017, Member of House of Representatives, Federal Parliament of Nepal
  • 2017 Deputy Prime -Minister and Minister for foreign Affairs Government of Nepal.
  • 2016 Deputy Prime-Minister and Minister, Ministry of Finance, Government of Nepal.
  • 2012 member of task force of draft on political consensus and constitutional for interim electoral cabinet.
  • 2011 Deputy Prime-Minister and Minister, Minister of Home Affair, Government of Nepal.
  • 2009 Minister, Ministry of Information and Communication and spokes person of Government of Nepal.
  • 2008 Elected as a member of constitution assembly form Constitute no.3 of Dang District.
  • 2007 Minister, Ministry of Information and communication and spokes person of Government of Nepal.
  • 2007 Nominated as a member of Interim Parliament established according to interim constitution and became a leader of CPN (Maoist) in parliament.
  • 1993 Elected and worked as a Member of Parliament from constituent no.2 of Rolpa District.

Party Responsibilities

  • 2016-2018 March, Central member of party headquarter (CPN Maoist Center)
  • 2014  General Secretary of UCPN (Maoist)
  • 2011 member of UCPN (Maoist) 7th national congress organization committee & chief of central organization committee of UCPN (Maoist).
  • 2010 Nominated as the chief of international bureau of United Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2009 From the Party unification assembly, Elected and working as a standing committee member of United Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2007 Coordinator of 3st Negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with Government of Nepal.
  • 2006 Standing Committee Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2005 spokesperson of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist).
  • 2004 Spokes person and member of 2nd negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with His’ Majesty of Government of Nepal.
  • 2002 Coordinator of 1st Negotiation team on behalf of Maoist party to do negotiation with His’ Majesty of Government of Nepal.
  • 1999 Polite bureau Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist
  • 1999 Central committee Member of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)        
  • 1995 Regional bureau Member of Western Region of Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
  • 1994 Member of Regional bureau of Rapti region of Communist Party of Nepal (United Center).
  • 1993 Appointed as a District Committee Secretary (DCS) of Rolpa for Communist Party of Nepal (Masal).
  • 1983-1985 Involved in Student politics as an Elected Central Committee Member of All Nepal National Independent Student Union(8th) and Treasure of Free Student Union of P.N. Campus Pokhara.
  • 1980-1983 District Secretary of Nepal National Teachers’ Association. National representative of Nepal National Teachers’ Association.
  • 1981 Party Member of Nepal Communist Party and District Committee Member of Rolpa district.
  • 1980- 2000 Involved in the student politics/movement as an active member

Other Responsibilities

  • 1980-1992 Worked as a Science and mathematics Teacher. 
  • 1985-1989 General Secretary of Nepal Red Cross Society, Rolpa.
  • 1981 Chief Editor, Hataru literary magazine Rolpa (First literary magazine in rolpa)​

Foreign Visits:  India, China, Thailand, USA, Japan, North Korea, Malaysia, Singapore, Hongkong, South Korea, United Kingdom, UAE, Qatar, Bangladesh, Pakistan.

description_np:
Name                   -         Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda'

Father's Name    -         Muktiram Dahal

Mother's Name   -         Bhawani Dahal

Place of Birth      -         Dhikur Pokhari V.D.C., Ward No-2, Lewade, Kaski

Date of Birth        -         26-Mangsir, 2011 B.S. (Dec 11, 1954 A.D.)

Brother and Sisters      -      1 younger brother, 6 younger sisters

Marital Status     -         Married with Sita Poudel, Baishakh 2026

 

Family

Wife                      -         Sita Poudel

Son                       -         Late Prakash Dahal

Daughters           -         Late Gyanu Dahal, Renu Dahal, and Ganga Dahal

Migration             -         Migrated to Shivanagar V.D.C., Chitwan from Place of

                                         Birth in 2019 (B.S.)

 

Academic Qualification

Qualification   Year       -      Name of institution

Literate   -            -         Dhikur Pokhari, Kaski

Secondary Education -      Narayani Bidhya Mandir Ma.Vi. Shivanagar, Chitwan

I.Sc                       -         2027-2029 Patan Multiple Campus, Lalitpur

B.Sc-Ag.              -         2031-2033 Agriculture Campus, Rampur, Chitwan

M.P.A. (Not Complate) -      T.U. Kathmandu

 

Designation          :  Chairman of Nepal Communist Party

  • Ex Prime Minister of Nepal
  •  Member Parliament of Nepal

Service :

Teacher :

  • Narayani Vidhya Mandir Secondary School, Shivnagar, Chitwan, Nepal – 1973
  • Janta Secondary School, Tirbhubantar, Nawalparasi, Nepal – 1976
  • Bhimodaya Secondary School, Aarughat, Gorkha, Nepal – 1976-1978

Brief Political Background –

  • Membership of Communist Party of Nepal ( Pushpa Lal Faction) taken – 1973
  • Organized a Marxist Study Circle – 1974
  • Entered into the another faction of Communist Party, Fourth Congress – 1977
  • Took active part as an underground whole timer cadre of the party – 1978
  •  District Committee Member of Chitwan District, Nepal – 1979
  •  Regional Bureau Member of CPN – 1981
  •  General Secretary of All Nepal Youth Association – 1981
  •  Chairman of All Nepal Youth Association – 1983
  • Member of Central Committee, CPN (Mashal) – 1984
  • Member of Central Committee Politburo, CPN (Mashal) – 1985
  • General Secretary of Central Committee, CPN (Mashal) -  1990
  • Took lead role to reunite the different factions of CPN, formed CPN (Unity Centre)  and elected  General Secretary – 1992
  • CPN (Unity Centre) transferred itself to CPN (Maoist) by its 3rd plenary meeting after 1st National Conference and Prachanda was again General Secretary of the party – 1995
  • Party declared Peoples’ war under the leadership of comrade Prachanda – 1996 Feb, 26 (The civil war ran for the ten consecutive years till 2006)
  • Chairman of CPN (Maoist) – 2001
  • Supreme Commander of Peoples’ Liberation Army, Nepal - 2002
  • Over grounded from Prime Minister’s residence, Nepal -  June 16, 2006
  • A Signatory among two in the historical Comprehensive Peace Agreement of Nepal – November, 2006
  • Chairman – Extended Lumbini Development Instruction Committee – 2012
  • Chairman of Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) from the 7th General Congress of Unity – 2012
  • Prime Minister – 2008  (The first elected Prime Minister of republic of Nepal)
  • Leader of Oppisition, 2009
  • Leader of Oppisition, 200
  • Coordinator – High Level Political Committee (2015)
  • Member of Constituent Assembly / Parliament, Nepal –
  • Kathmandu -10 and Rolpa-2 – 2007
  • Siraha 5 – 2014
  • Prime Minister – 2016 
  • Parliament Member Chitwan 3 – (Now)
  • Chairman – Nepal Communist Party

Publications

  • Problems of Nepalese Revolution ( Volume 1, 2 and 3)
  • Selected Works of Prachanda (Vol 1 and 2)
  • Selected Military Works of  Prachanda

description_np:
• ठेगाना :- अर्घाखाँची जिल्ला, सन्धिखर्क न.पा.-९ ।
  • बाबु/आमाको नाम :- स्व. काशीनाथ गौतम/ शारदा गौतम ।
  • शैक्षिक योग्यता :- राजनीतिशास्त्रमा स्नातकोत्तर र कानूनमा स्नातक ।
  • राजनीतिक आबद्धता :- २०३६ साल देखी नेपाल विद्यार्थी संघमा आबद्ध भई सक्रिय राजनीतिमा संलग्न । नेपाल महिला संघको महासचिव । नेपाली कांग्रेस केन्द्रीय महिला विभाग तथा केन्द्रीय कानूनी सल्लाहकार समितिको सदस्य । नेपाल ट्रेड यूनियन कांग्रेसको सल्लाहकार भई काम गरेको । नेपाली कांग्रेसको केन्द्रीय सदस्य ।
  • पेशागत आबद्धता :- त्रिभुवन विश्वविद्यालय अन्तर्गत रत्‍न राज्य लक्ष्मी क्याम्पसमा २०४६ साल देखी १० वर्ष सम्म उपप्राध्यापक पदमा रही प्रध्यापन गरेको । २०३९ साल देखी कानून व्यवसायमा सक्रिय भएको/वरिष्ठ अधिवक्ता । महिला अधिकार, कानून र राजनीतिक क्षेत्रसँग सम्बन्धित विभिन्न राष्ट्रिय तथा अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय संघ संस्थामा प्रतिनिधित्व गरेको ।
  • संसदीय यात्रा :- २०५६ सालको प्रतिनिधि सभा निर्वाचन तथा २०७० सालको संविधान सभा निर्वाचनमा  अर्घाखाँची जिल्ला,  निर्वाचन क्षेत्र नं. –२,  नेपाली कांग्रेसको तर्फबाट उम्मेदवार बनेको तथा २०६४ सालको संविधान सभामा प्रत्यक्ष निर्वाचनमा निर्वाचित भएको ।
  • विशेष जिम्मेवारी :- २०६३ सालमा अन्तरिम संविधान मस्यौदा समितिको सदस्य भई कार्य सम्पादन गरेको।  २०७४ सालको प्रतिनिधि सभामा नेपाली कांग्रेस संसदीय दलको सचेतक पदमा जिम्मेवारी बहन गरेको । हाल २०७९ साल असार ३१ गते प्रतिनिधि सभाको उपसभामुखको पदमा निर्वाचित भई कार्यभार सम्हाल्दै आएको ।
  • राजनीतिक घटनाक्रम :- बाबु (पूर्व मन्त्री स्व. काशीनाथ गौतम) सँगै सानै उमेरमा भारतमा लगभग १३ वर्ष  निर्वासनमा बसेको । राजनीतिक आन्दोलनको क्रममा पटक-पटक गिरफ्तारी ।
  • विशेष रूची :- अध्ययन,  अनुसन्धान र संगीत ।
  • संस्थागत आबद्धता :- नेपाल बार एशोसिएसन, राष्ट्रिय मानव अधिकार संगठन, नेपाल कानून समाज।
  • email :- pushpa605@gmail.com
  • Contact no :- +977-9841255545

  • email :- pushpa605@gmail.com
  • Contact no :- +977-9841255545

description_np:
Phone No.:

00(977) 021-415160(Res), 9842164408(Mobile)

E-mail:

shiva_tumba@parliament.gov.np,  shiva_tumba@yahoo.com

Permanent Add:

Biratnagar Metropolitan city 
 

Biratnagar -8, Pragati tole

Date of birth:

18/01/1964

Marital status:

Married

Sex:    

Female  

Language:    

English, Nepali, Limbu (mother tongue), Hindi 
   

 

Education
 

Ph.D. in political science on 'Political Women Movement in Nepal (1990- 2003)', Tribhuvan University, Nepal 

   

M.A. in political Science, Tribhuvan University, Nepal    
 

B.L. in Law, Tribhuvan University, Nepal  
 

B. Ed. in Education, Tribhuvan University, Nepal 

                                                                  

  
 

Proficiency Certificate in Law, Tribhuvan University, Nepal   

                           

School Leaving Certificate, His Majesty's Government Board, Nepal
   

 

Professional Experiences 

Since 2008-2017  

Assistant lecture -Post graduate Campus, Tribhuvan University, Biratnagar, Nepal

Since 2009-2012 

Executive Member-Women Rehabilitation Center, Kathmandu, Nepal 

Since 2007

Executive Member –National Alliance Women Human Rights 

Since 2007 

Coordinator - Women Human Rights Defenders, Morang, Nepal

Since 2001

Member Indigenous Nationalities Upliftment Center, Kathmandu, Nepal 

1995

Executive Member- Non-government Organization National Preparation Committee Nepal Beijing for conference (N.N.P.C N.G.O.Coalition), Nepal

1994-1996    

Vice-president All Nepal National Free Student Union, Central Committee, Nepal                 

1992-1996   

Members - Women Security Pressure Group, Centre committee, Nepal

1991-1995   

Executive Members - Action for Solidarity, Equality, Environment  Development (ASEED), Asia

1986 -1988 

Treasurer-Free Student Union, Nepal law Campus, Kathmandu 
   

 

Trainer

Since 2001 

Gender issues and Development, Social mobilization, Women Movement in Nepal, Women Legal Rights ,Capacity Building for Leadership Training, Constituent Assembly and Constitution, Gender discrimination  in political party, Leadership Training, Women Human Rights Defenders etc.
   
 

Consultant

Nov-Dec2006

Worked as a consultant on Mid-Term Assessment of Inclusion Project under Plan Nepal, Biratnagar, Nepal
   

 

Training

2011 (6days)

Regional Gender and Politics Training of trainers (TOT) organized by Asian Pacific on Women, Law and Development (APWLD), Kathmandu, Nepal. 

2009(5days)

Training of trainers (TOT) on strategies and skill on monitoring and protection of Human Rightss, organized by office of the high commissioner for Human Rights in Nepal (OHCHR), Nepal.                                                      

2009(5days)

Training of trainers (TOT) on Women Human Rights Defenders, organized by office of the high commissioner for Human Rights in Nepal (OHCHR), Nepal and Women Rehabilitation Center, Nepal.  

2006(1month)

Feminist capacity building course on Gender, Peace and Sustainable Development, organized by South Asian Network of Gender Activists and Trainers (SANGAT), Nepal,

2002(1 Month)

Training of trainers (TOT) for strengthening the labour migration process and the combating trafficking in Women and children in Nepal, organized by and Women Rehabilitation Center, Nepal.                  

1996(1week) 

Training on Human Rightss, jointly organized by Asian Human Rightss Commission (AHRC) and Asian Student Association (ASA) Kathmandu, Nepal

1991(2week)

Training on Environment and sustainable development, organized by ASEED, Costa Rica.

1991(15 days) 

Training on Women Leadership, Kathmandu, organized by international  union of Student and Asian students Association          
   

 

Participation

2007(1 day)

Preparatory proposal writing seminar for potential SIRF research organized by Social Science Baha & Social Inclusion Research Fund Secretariat/ SNV, Kathmandu, Nepal 

2003

Asian Social Forum, Hyderabad, India      

2000

Workshop on Surviving Crises, Rebuilding Resistance Women's Struggle Sustainable Development in South Asia, Kathmandu, Nepal

1994

National Conference, Pokhara, organized by Bar Association, Nepal 

1993

South Asian Youth and Student Festival, New Delhi, India
   

 

Organizer 

2009(2 days)

Eastern regional Women social forum program, organized by National Alliance Women Human Rights Defenders, Biratnagar, Morang  

2006

Awareness building Program on Constituent Assembly and Constituent in Morang district organized by SRI – Nepal, support by IGD

1994

Women Student Leader in Students Movement, organized by All Nepal National
 

Free Student Union Central Committee Lalitpur
   

 

Publications

2002

Women Movement in Nepal (1947-1990), 
 

Many articles are Publish on the Nepali daily, weekly, monthly of the Nepali newspaper.                        

2010

Nepalma Mahila Andolan by Bani prahashan, Biratnagar. 
   

                      

Main Areas of Research

2011(running) 

Violence again Women of witchcraft case study from Morang Fund study from Morang Fund by NFDIN by COCON.  

2011 (6 month) 

Political and Economic status of the Gangai community case 

2010 (running) 

Political and Economic marginalization of the Santhal community: a case study from Jhapa Fund by Social Inclusion Research Fund (SIRF) SNV,Nepal. 

2010(6 month)

Ethnographic Profile of Gangai Fund by NFDIN.

2009(6 month)

Limbu community of Participation on politics Fund by NFDIN.

2002-2007
